sprouts

Interface Var<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the wrapped item.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Val<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractVariable

    public interface Var<T>
extends Val<T>
    A mutable wrapper for an item which can be observed by the UI (or other application layers) to then dynamically update the UI components for you, as well as trigger an action inside your view model.

    So for example if you have a Var which represents the username of a form, in your UI you can register a callback which will update the UI accordingly or trigger a view model action.
    Consider the following example property in your view model: 

    
 	    // A username property with a validation action:
 		private final Var<String> username = Var.of("").onAct( v -> validateUser(v) );
    And the following Swing-Tree example UI: 
    
 	    UI.textField()
 	    .peek( ta -> vm.getUsername().onSet( t -> ta.setText(t.get()) ) )
 	    .onKeyReleased( e -> vm.getUsername().act( ta.getText() ) );
    Your view will automatically update the text field with the item of the property and inside your view model you can also update the item of the property to be shown in the UI: 
    
 	    // Initially empty username:
 		username.set( "" ) // triggers 'fireSet()';

    Please take a look at the living sprouts documentation where you can browse a large collection of examples demonstrating how to use the API of this class.

      • Fields inherited from interface sprouts.Val

        EMPTY, ID_PATTERN, NO_ID

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Var<T> act(T newValue)
      Updates the state of this property and then, if the state has changed, trigger its action using the fireAct() method but not the Val.fireSet().
      Var<T> fireAct()
      Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using onAct(Action).
      default Var<T> map(java.util.function.Function<T,T> mapper)
      Essentially the same as Optional.map(Function).
      default <U> Var<U> mapTo(java.lang.Class<U> type, java.util.function.Function<T,U> mapper) 
      static <T,V extends T>
      Var<T>      		 of(java.lang.Class<T> type, V item)
      This factory method returns a Var describing the given non-null item similar to Optional.of(Object) and its type which may also be a super type of the item.
      static <T> Var<T> of(T item)
      This factory method returns a Var describing the given non-null item similar to Optional.of(Object), but specifically designed for use with Swing-Tree.
      static <T> Var<T> ofNullable(java.lang.Class<T> type, T item)
      Use this factory method to create a new Var instance whose item may or may not be null.
      Var<T> onAct(Action<Val<T>> action)
      Use this method to add an action to this property which is supposed to be triggered when the UI changes the item of this property through the Var::act(T) method, or simply when it is explicitly triggered by the Var::act(T) method.
      Var<T> set(T newItem)
      This method provides the ability to change the state of the wrapper.
      Var<T> withId(java.lang.String id)
      Use this method to create a new property with an id.

    • Method Detail

      • ofNullable

        static <T> Var<T> ofNullable(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                             T item)
        Use this factory method to create a new Var instance whose item may or may not be null.

        Example: 

        
      Var.ofNullable(String.class, null);

        Specified by:
        ofNullable in interface Val<T>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the wrapped item.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the item wrapped by the property. This is used to check if the item is of the correct type.
        item - The initial item of the property. This may be null.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance.

      • of

        static <T> Var<T> of(T item)
        This factory method returns a Var describing the given non-null item similar to Optional.of(Object), but specifically designed for use with Swing-Tree.
        Specified by:
        of in interface Val<T>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item held by the Var!
        Parameters:
        item - The initial item of the property which must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance wrapping the given item.

      • of

        static <T,V extends T> Var<T> of(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                 V item)
        This factory method returns a Var describing the given non-null item similar to Optional.of(Object) and its type which may also be a super type of the item.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the item held by the Var!
        V - The type of the item which is wrapped by the returned Var!
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the item wrapped by the property.
        item - The initial item of the property which must not be null.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance wrapping the given item.

      • set

        Var<T> set(T newItem)
        This method provides the ability to change the state of the wrapper. It might have several side effects depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        newItem - The new item which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • withId

        Var<T> withId(java.lang.String id)
        Use this method to create a new property with an id. This id is used to identify the property in the UI or as a key in a map, which is useful when converting your view model to a JSON object, or similar formats.
        Specified by:
        withId in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the property.
        Returns:
        A new Var instance with the given id.

      • onAct

        Var<T> onAct(Action<Val<T>> action)
        Use this method to add an action to this property which is supposed to be triggered when the UI changes the item of this property through the Var::act(T) method, or simply when it is explicitly triggered by the Var::act(T) method.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be triggered when Var::act(T) or Var::fireAct() is called.
        Returns:
        This very property instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • fireAct

        Var<T> fireAct()
        Triggers the action associated with this property, if one was set using onAct(Action). This method is intended to be used in the UI to indicate that the user has changed the item of the property not your view model.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • act

        Var<T> act(T newValue)
        Updates the state of this property and then, if the state has changed, trigger its action using the fireAct() method but not the Val.fireSet().
        This method is intended to be used in the UI. If you want to modify the state of the property from the view model, as part of your business logic, you should use the Var::set(T) method instead.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new item which ought to replace the old one.
        Returns:
        This very wrapper instance, in order to enable method chaining.

      • map

        default Var<T> map(java.util.function.Function<T,T> mapper)
        Essentially the same as Optional.map(Function). but with a Val as return type.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Val<T>
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function to apply to an item, if present
        Returns:
        the result of applying an Optional-bearing mapping
